name: NCD - Diagnosis and Treatment of Impotence
description: Impotence is a failure of a body part for which the diagnosis, and frequently the treatment, require medical expertise. Treatment may be surgical, such as implantation of a penile prosthesis, or nonsurgical, such as medical or psychotherapeutic treatment. Program payment may be made for diagnosis and treatment of sexual impotence.

restrictions.condition: Coverage requires a diagnosis of sexual impotence.
Surgical treatment, such as implantation of a penile prosthesis, is covered for impotence.
Nonsurgical medical treatment for impotence is covered.
Nonsurgical psychotherapeutic treatment for impotence is covered.
Psychiatric service limitation applies if treatment is furnished to patients who are not hospital inpatients.
Psychiatric service limitation applies if treatment is furnished in connection with a mental condition.
